augmentin: A combination antibiotic used to treat a wide variety of bacterial infections.
pan d: A proton pump inhibitor and prokinetic agent, used to treat gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD).
diclofenac: A nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug (NSAID) used to treat pain and inflammatory conditions.
omeprozole: A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that reduces the amount of acid produced in the stomach.
betaloc: A beta-blocker used to treat high blood pressure (hypertension) and angina.
enzoflam: A combination drug with enzymes and NSAIDs to relieve swelling (edema) and pain.
hexigel gum paint: An antiseptic gel (chlorhexidine) to treat gingivitis, mouth ulcers, and oral infections.
ultrafen-plus: A combination painkiller, often containing an NSAID and paracetamol, for moderate pain.
relentus: A cough syrup or tablet formulation for relieving cough, cold, and allergy symptoms.
progen: Often a brand name for progesterone or a protein supplement.
ultracal-d: A supplement containing Calcium and Vitamin D3, used to treat or prevent bone loss.
cartilix: A supplement, often containing glucosamine, aimed at supporting cartilage and joint health.
dorzolamidum: A carbonic anhydrase inhibitor used as eye drops to lower pressure inside the eye.
cimetidine: An H2 receptor blocker that reduces stomach acid. Less common now.
oxprelol: A non-selective beta blocker, less commonly used now, for hypertension.
paracetamol: Commonly used to treat fever and mild to moderate pain.
atorvastatin: A statin used to lower cholesterol and triglycerides.
metformin: An oral medication that helps control blood sugar levels.
amlodipine: A calcium channel blocker used to treat high blood pressure.
cetirizine: An antihistamine used to relieve allergy symptoms.
azithromycin: An antibiotic used to treat a variety of bacterial infections.
montelukast: Used to prevent wheezing and difficulty breathing caused by asthma.
losartan: An ARB used to treat high blood pressure.
sertraline: An SSRI antidepressant used to treat depression and anxiety disorders.
esomeprazole: A proton pump inhibitor (PPI) that reduces stomach acid.
clopidogrel: An antiplatelet medicine used to prevent blood clots.
domperidone: A prokinetic agent used to treat nausea and vomiting.
ibuprofen: A common NSAID used for pain relief, fever, and inflammation.
pregabalin: Used to treat epilepsy, anxiety, and neuropathic (nerve) pain.
tamsulosin: An alpha-blocker used by men to treat the symptoms of an enlarged prostate (BPH).
fexofenadine: A non-drowsy antihistamine for seasonal allergies.
glimepiride: A sulfonylurea drug that helps the pancreas produce more insulin.
bisoprolol: A beta-blocker that affects the heart and circulation.
tacrolimus: An immunosuppressive drug used to prevent organ rejection after a transplant.
colchicine: Used to treat and prevent gout attacks.
phenytoin: An anti-epileptic drug used to control seizures.
isotretinoin: A powerful vitamin A derivative used to treat severe cystic acne.
allopurinol: Reduces the production of uric acid in the body, preventing gout.
methotrexate: An immunosuppressant used for rheumatoid arthritis and some cancers.
sofosbuvir: An antiviral medication used to treat Hepatitis C.
enoxaparin: An anticoagulant (LMWH) injection used to prevent deep vein thrombosis.
rituximab: A monoclonal antibody used to treat certain autoimmune diseases and cancers.
ondansetron: An antiemetic used to prevent nausea and vomiting caused by chemotherapy or surgery.
carbamazepine: An anticonvulsant used to treat epilepsy, bipolar disorder, and neuropathic pain.
latanoprost: Eye drops used to control the progression of glaucoma by reducing intraocular pressure.
mycophenolate: An immunosuppressant used to prevent organ rejection.
adalimumab: A biologic drug (TNF inhibitor) used for autoimmune conditions.
acyclovir: An antiviral medication used to treat herpes simplex, chickenpox, and shingles.
